description.narrative: The project to support the UN Network and its participating agencies IOM and UNDP to provide coherent institutional support to the Government of Iraq (GOI) by building institutional migration management capacities and implement frameworks.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Output 1: The UN Network on Mi-gration in Iraq is functioning with an established Coordinator and Secretariat Output 1 from the UNDAF Project is Not Applicable to UNDP Iraq.
Output 2: Government and local stakeholders have institutional and analytical capacities on migration -Indicators: Number of thematic migration governance training sessions provided based on gaps identified by the migration network and SDG thematic areas related to migration including SDG 5 and SDG 16 -Indicators: SDGs mainstreamed into Iraqi strategic national documents (Y/N) -Indicators: Number of consultation sessions with migration governance and other stakeholders on Iraq’s VNR conducted
Output 3: Research on migration related topics and trends is made available and supports improved knowledge -Indicators: Research on pertinent migration topics is produced, disseminated and utilised by partners (UNDP) (Y/N)
Output4: Local actors have stronger understanding of migration related issues and ability to address them -Indicators: Safe spaces for women in the local communities are established (Y/N) -Indicators: Number of trainings for youth on skills to boost labour market supply conducted

Output 1: The UN Network on Mi-gration in Iraq is functioning with an established Coordinator and Secretariat Output 1 from the UNDAF Project is Not Applicable to UNDP Iraq.
Output 2: Government and local stakeholders have institutional and analytical capacities on migration -Annual Target: 3 thematic migration governance training sessions provided based on gaps identified by the migration network and SDG thematic areas related to migration including SDG 5 and SDG 16 -Annual Target: SDGs mainstreamed into Iraqi strategic national documents (Y) -Annual Target: 3 consultation sessions with migration governance and other stakeholders on Iraq’s VNR conducted
Output 3: Research on migration related topics and trends is made available and supports improved knowledge -Annual Target: Research on pertinent migration topics is produced, disseminated and utilised by partners (Y)
Output4: Local actors have stronger understanding of migration related issues and ability to address them -Annual Target: Safe spaces for women in the local communities are established (Y) -Annual Target: 5 trainings for youth on skills to boost labour market supply conducted

Output 1: The UN Network on Mi-gration in Iraq is functioning with an established Coordinator and Secretariat -Output 1 from the UNDAF Project is Not Applicable for UNDP Iraq.
Output 2: Government and local stakeholders have institutional and analytical capacities on migration -Results: 3 thematic migration governance training sessions implemented based on gaps identified by the migration network and SDG thematic areas related to migration including SDG 5 and SDG 16 -Results: SDGs mainstreamed into Iraqi strategic national documents -Results: 3 consultation sessions with migration governance and other stakeholders on Iraq’s VNR conducted
Output 3: Research on migration related topics and trends is made available and supports improved knowledge -Results: Research on pertinent migration topics has been produced, disseminated and utilized by partners
Output4: Local actors have stronger understanding of migration related issues and ability to address them -Results: Safe spaces for women in the local communities have been established -Results: 5 trainings for youth on skills to boost labour market supply have been implemented
